intro: Rostellularia quadrifaria, commonly known as the four-leafed rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and its stems are usually square in cross-section. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
